message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques to predict the relative reading difficulty of a set of sentences. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses logistic regression and Bayesian rating system, which are common techniques in machine learning and data analysis, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of lexical and grammatical features, which are important in natural language processing and could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also deals with ranking and prediction, which could fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CY (Computers and Society).
